   \[
   \text{Number of dogs} = 3 \times \text{Number of cats} = 3 \times 3 = 9
   \]

   \[
   \text{Number of rabbits} = \text{Number of dogs} - 2 = 9 - 2 = 7
   \]

   \[
   \text{Number of fish} = 149269 \times \text{Number of rabbits} = 149269 \times 7 = 1044883
   \]

   \[
   \text{Number of gerbils} = \frac{1}{3} \times \text{Number of fish} = \frac{1}{3} \times 1044883 = 348294.33
   \]
   Since Larry cannot have a fraction of a gerbil, we'll round down to 348294 or round appropriately if we consider it as a whole number.

- Cats: 3
- Dogs: 9
- Rabbits: 7
- Fish: 1044883
- Gerbils: 348294

\[
\text{Total pets} = \text{Cats} + \text{Dogs} + \text{Rabbits} + \text{Fish} + \text{Gerbils}
\]

\text{Total pets} = 3 + 9 + 7 + 1044883 + 348294 = 1390596
\]

   \[ \text{Number of gerbils} = 348294 \]  

[Verification]

\]
\[
\text{Total Pets} = 3 + 9 + 7 + 1,044,883 + 348,294
\]
\[
\text{Total Pets} = 1,393,196
\]
